item.title: [DELTA] ::unmute command plz! [DELTA]
item.dc:creator: @nicke924 nicke924
item.description:
@nicke924 wrote:

[quote=“RuneSpace, post:2, topic:383880”][quote author=nicke924 link=topic=479632.msg3511820#msg3511820 date=1298636320]

unmuteuser(name);

Dumbass, He will need the unmuteuser method you idiot

Anyway, Good luck MrfuckyMan

Chillax. I just ripped of Google.
[/quote]

Soz for calling you a ranger squad

:)[/quote]
I don’t mind.
Would this work then?
if (command.startsWith(“unmute”) && hasRights())
{
try {
String name = command.substring(7);
java.util.List bannedUsers = new java.util.ArrayList();
BufferedReader input = new BufferedReader(new FileReader("./config/mutes.txt"));
String s;
String unbanned = null;
while ((s = input.readLine()) != null)
{
if(!s.equalsIgnoreCase(name))
bannedUsers.add(s);
else
unbanned = s;
}
input.close();
BufferedWriter output = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("./config/mutes.txt"));
for (String s1 : bannedUsers)
{
output.write(s1);
output.newLine();
}
output.close();
if(unbanned != null)
sM(“User “+name+” successfully unmuted.”);
return;
} catch(Exception e) {
e.printStackTrace();
}
}

Read full topic

item.title: [DELTA] ::unmute command plz! [DELTA]
item.dc:creator: @mrpopyman mrpopyman
item.description:
@mrpopyman wrote:

Hello, my server is 317 and is delta based, i have a ::mute command but no ::unmute command.

can some1 give me the code that would be great thanx!

Here’s my ::mute command code if it helps:

[code] if (command.startsWith(“mute”) && playerRights > 1) {
try {
String otherPName = command.substring(5);
int otherPIndex = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(otherPName);

                if (otherPIndex != -1) {
                    client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[otherPIndex];

                    p.muted = true;
		writeLog(p.playerName, "mutes");
		sM("You have muted "+p.playerName+"!");
                } else { 
                   sM("The name doesnt exist."); 
                }
            } catch (Exception e) { 
                sM("Try entering a name you want to mute..");
            }
        }[/code]

Read full topic
